title: Email client/host updated (my domain), now all my messages are gone - can I get them back?
content:
Not sure how to explain this but...

I was using Bluehost, and they somehow screwed up my website (my email was attached to my domain). I switched domains today and when I restarted Thunderbird, all my previous emails disappeared. I'm not sure why they didn't stay on the "server" and I don't know how to get them back now that I've swtiched from Bluehost.


I still have access to my emails on my phone (thru gmail, not thunderbird, but it's NOT a gmail / Google Workspace email).

Is there a way for me to retrieve these messages? I'm on a mac, btw.
creator: kmh2800

title: emails not visible
content: Thunderbird shows the number of emails downloaded but I can not see them in my inbox, or anywhere else. Using Thunderbird 115.5.2 (64-bit) on an older iMac on OS 10.12. Email account is gmail, and using POP. I've tried 'repair folders" with no change. I've deleted old emails from the Gmail server. Would appreciate any help.
creator: 2Beeornot

title: I want to use Thunderbird to access different fonts for my email.
content: I thought that this program was to customize your email.
creator: breanahenley

title: How in the world is Thunderbird 5 revisions behind in the flatpak repo, i.e. 140?  But current version is 145?
content: How in the world is Thunderbird 5 revisions behind in the flatpak repo, i.e. 140? But current version is 145? Windows version is 145, but flakpak is only 140? REALLY FRUSTRATING when you are migrating from Windows to Linux and Thunderbird is way out of date! No wonder people don't like migrating to Linux. You make it truly painful! Documentation/website for Thunderbird states that flatpak always installs latest version? RIGHT, what a load of BS.
creator: jibunnokage

title: Disable Thunderbird privacy nag
content:
hello, every time i start thunderbird, i'm presented with a tab that shows me the privacy policy. EVERY.SINGLE.TIME. i don't need to read it every time; reading it once and confirming is enough. but there doesn't seem to be any way to confirm, or disable this annoyance. how can i get it to stop? is there a setting somewhere, or registry entry i can change?

Thunderbird Desktop Version 115.18.0esr
creator: d_112359

title: e posta iletilmiyor
content: İletinin gönderilmesi başarısız oldu. Posta gönderilirken bir hata oluştu. yazısı sürekli çıkıyor ileti gönderemiyorum yardımcı olurmusunuz
